alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Lamar; Marion (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 2:56PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Marion, western Fayette and southeastern Lamar Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 256 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lake Buttahatchee to 6 miles southeast of Vernon. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Winfield, Fayette, Guin, Brilliant, Glen Allen, Kennedy, Belk, Gu- Win, Blooming Grove, Lake Buttahatchee, Bluff, Crossville, Twin, Tucker, Cody, Bazemore, Wayside, Richard Arthur Field, Bevill State College Fayette and Hubbertville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
